content: >http://www.nytimes.com/2009/05/03/world/middleeast/03iraq.html?_r=2&ref=world Iraqi police and military forces were engaged by the security detail when they attempted to arrest the Minister of Trade and some deputies on corruption charges. In the melee, the minister and other suspects managed to escape. It is thought he is headed for England via Basra. Two other foremer ministers are 'on the lam' from charges of graft. US sources estimate that $4 billion per year is lost to corruption , Iraqi sources estimate the cost to be as much as $18 billion.

In the melee, the minister and other suspects managed to escape. It is thought he is headed for England via Basra. Two other foremer ministers are 'on the lam' from charges of graft. US sources estimate that $4 billion per year is lost to corruption , Iraqi sources estimate the cost to be as much as $18 billion.
title: Corruption investigation Spurs Baghdad Gunfight
